docs.snippet: The dirt-eaters of the Orinoco are a very miserable and degraded folk, whose abject condition is well calculated to excite the warmest compassion in the hearts of all well-fed, wellclothed, well-bled and comfortable Christians. Their ethical rank in...
docs.lead_paragraph: The dirt-eaters of the Orinoco are a very miserable and degraded folk, whose abject condition is well calculated to excite the warmest compassion in the hearts of all well-fed, wellclothed, well-bled and comfortable Christians. Their ethical rank in the race is even lower than that of the Feejeean savages, of whom an English midshipman wrote to his mother that their " manners were none-and their customs filthy."

docs.snippet: LOVE. From the French of M. J. MICHELET. By. J. W. PALMER, M. D. New-York: RUDD  CARLETON. In translating MICHELET'S very original and interesting treatise on Love, Dr. PALMER has done a bold thing, which in the eyes even of many not over-fastidious...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOVE. From the French of M. J. MICHELET. By. J. W. PALMER, M. D. New-York: RUDD CARLETON. In translating MICHELET'S very original and interesting treatise on Love, Dr. PALMER has done a bold thing, which in the eyes even of many not over-fastidious persons will seem, we doubt not, too bold.

docs.snippet: The superior authenticity of the French over the Austrian reports of occurrences at the seat of wart has been curiously illustrated in the case of the most recent news. Through Germany and England the tidings of the Battle of Magenta came to us...
docs.lead_paragraph: The superior authenticity of the French over the Austrian reports of occurrences at the seat of wart has been curiously illustrated in the case of the most recent news. Through Germany and England the tidings of the Battle of Magenta came to us embellished with accounts of the " disgrace of Marshal BARAGUAY D'HILLIERS," and of the fall of Marshal CANROBERT, mortally wounded in action."

docs.snippet: The Administration despairs of any change for the better in Mexico-at least for some time to come. Mr. BUCHANAN says he shall interfere in no way what ever,nor does he believe that Congress will do anything in the premises. Nothing has been heard...

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; The Administration and Mexico Governor Walker and Mr. Buchanan--Coal Contracts for the Navy. INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON. Letter from Judge Douglas on the Presidency.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Administration despairs of any change for the better in Mexico-at least for some time to come. Mr. BUCHANAN says he shall interfere in no way what ever,nor does he believe that Congress will do anything in the premises. Nothing has been heard from Mr McLANE lately. Troops will not be landed even at the solicitation of the Juarez Government, to protect American lives and property.

headline.main: Later from Rio Janeiro.; STATE OF THE COFFEE CROP--THE MARKETS--NAVAL INTELLIGENCE--MEETING OF THE CHAMBERS--HEALTH OF RIO.

docs.snippet: I gave in my last letter some of the leading featires of the Trinidad Immigration laws; sufficient, I hope, to convoy a correct idea of the system under which the Colony is being supplied with foreign labor, and of the manner in which that system has...

headline.main: EMANCIPATION IN THE WEST INDIES; Effects of the Importation of Free Labor in Trinidad.

docs.lead_paragraph: I gave in my last letter some of the leading featires of the Trinidad Immigration laws; sufficient, I hope, to convoy a correct idea of the system under which the Colony is being supplied with foreign labor, and of the manner in which that system has been reduced to practice. I do not hesitate to say-and no one here will express a contrary opinionthat immigration has been the salvation of Triniadd.

docs.snippet: BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.--At the meeting of the Board of Supervisors yesterday, the President, Mr. PURDY, offered a resolution directing the Special Committee on Building the new City Hall to inquire into the expenses incurred by the Commissioners...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.--At the meeting of the Board of Supervisors yesterday, the President, Mr. PURDY, offered a resolution directing the Special Committee on Building the new City Hall to inquire into the expenses incurred by the Commissioners appointed under the act of 1858 in relation to the new City Hall. It was adopted.

docs.snippet: ANNIVERSARY OF THE LIGHT GUARD. The New-York Light Guard, (Company A. Seventy-first Regiment,) in command of : Captain GARLAND and officered by Lieutenants HART and WEBB, celebrated their Thirty-second Anniversary, yesterday, by an excursion to...
docs.lead_paragraph: ANNIVERSARY OF THE LIGHT GUARD. The New-York Light Guard, (Company A. Seventy-first Regiment,) in command of : Captain GARLAND and officered by Lieutenants HART and WEBB, celebrated their Thirty-second Anniversary, yesterday, by an excursion to Staten Island, and by partaking of a dinner at the Chestnut Grove Hotel. They were accompanied by Dodworth's Band,

docs.snippet: The Crimean war was called, and not unjustly, a " soldier's war." Its victories were won mainly in spite of strategic blunders on the part of the commanders and by virtue of determined valor on the part of the troops. The operations of the war...

headline.main: The Victory of Magenta and Occupation of Milan.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Crimean war was called, and not unjustly, a " soldier's war." Its victories were won mainly in spite of strategic blunders on the part of the commanders and by virtue of determined valor on the part of the troops. The operations of the war afforded little opportunity for those manoeuvres and plans which, as the poet puts it,
